<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 120, 636, 145]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 175, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 212, 425, 260]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 212, 905, 256]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 178, 293]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|> 9702/31 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 359, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|> October/November 2020 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 700, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: The materials and apparatus listed in the confidential instructions <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 890, 605]]<|/det|> INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question.- You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 220, 649]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 728, 682]]<|/det|> INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[680, 720, 905, 850]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[284, 867, 712, 884]]<|/det|> This document has 12 pages. Blank pages are indicated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 739, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 94, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 693, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the equilibrium of a plastic cup.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 920, 167]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with a cup attached to a string loop. A mass is attached to the cup as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 175, 715, 356]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 370, 534, 389]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1.1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 401, 180, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 400, 546, 420]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 428, 828, 740]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 758, 534, 776]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1.2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 789, 178, 807]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 788, 853, 807]]<|/det|>
The horizontal distance between the edges of the cup is \(p\), as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 821, 384, 838]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 881, 920, 900]]<|/det|>
<form>p = .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 72, 720, 89]]<|/det|>
Pour approximately \(12 \text{cm}^3\) of water into the measuring cylinder.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 180, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 472, 120]]<|/det|>
The mass of \(1 \text{cm}^3\) of water is \(1 \text{g}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 133, 650, 151]]<|/det|>
Determine the mass of water in the measuring cylinder.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[519, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<form>mass = ....................................................... $g$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 257, 180, 276]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 257, 719, 276]]<|/det|>
Gently pour this water from the measuring cylinder into the cup.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 289, 180, 307]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 289, 561, 307]]<|/det|>
Record the total mass \(m\) of water in the cup.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[547, 380, 920, 398]]<|/det|>
<form>m = ............................................................ $g$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 412, 180, 431]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 412, 384, 431]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 504, 918, 523]]<|/det|>
<form>p = ............................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 918, 104]]<|/det|>
Using the measuring cylinder, add water to the cup to increase \(m\). Measure and record \(p\). Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(m\) and \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 116, 767, 135]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\sqrt{m}\) and \(\sqrt{p}\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 443, 920, 462]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 473, 144, 492]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 473, 175, 492]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 473, 677, 492]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(\sqrt{p}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\sqrt{m}\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 473, 920, 492]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 504, 180, 523]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 504, 457, 523]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 523]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 535, 608, 554]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 839, 121]]<|/det|>
